page.title: 16Impact of War
page.content: Other than having relatives fighting World War II made little impact on the area.A lot of bombs fell on York and people remember following the fire engines going to deal with blazing buildings.Only one bomb is recalled and it fell near the main railway line.It missed a train but blew up a stack of potatoes _ no trace of them was found afterwards.A horse was killed and some damage done to the line.Tholthorpe airfield,part of which is in the area,was in full operational use.One plane,apparently off course,tried to land in Raskelf hopping three times through hedges,a tennis court and stream, finally stopping at a tree nearly two miles away.There was also a searchlight in the village and a home guard company.
